text: - [Vinod] Hello, everyone.

I'm Vinod Kisanagaram,
solutions architect at AWS.

Now we are going to know
about the new features
of Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor.
For this demo, I have a couple
of internet monitors created already.
So let's explore the first one

where I created a
CloudFront internet monitor.

And as you can see here,
I added the resources
to be monitored are from CloudFront.

And I chose a 100% of the
traffic to be monitored.

Now, we can also publish
the internet measurements
to Amazon S3.

We can also add tags to our
CloudWatch internet monitor.
So with the new features
of Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor,

we have a new UI where we
can see several new tabs.
The first one is the overview tab.

The overview tab has
high level information
from each of other tabs at a glance.

Users can quickly visualize
any ongoing health events,
glance at traffic statistics,

and preview traffic
optimization suggestions.
In the health events tab,

we get the internet traffic
overview across the globe

and we can highlight the
top impacted locations
and we can get the details.
We can also zoom in and zoom out the map.
In the bottom, we can switch the timelines
and we can see the top health events.
And if you wanted to know more,
we can just click on the client location
and we get the event details here.
The event has started this particular time
and ended at this time,

and also tells the details
of the duration of the event
and the impact of overall traffic.
Now on the analyze tab, we get the details
around the top client locations
and we can also sort by total traffic
or the availability score,
and we can even flip the sorting order,
whether we want it to be highest to lowest
or lowest to highest.
We can also filter by the city locations
or the metro or subdivision.

And also we can choose the
IPv4 prefixes or addresses.
We can adjust the timelines on the top

and the graph reflects to
the new adjusted timelines.
And we get the details

about the top client
locations traffic summary,
and we can also get the details
around the traffic health score

and how it is performing against
the configured thresholds.

We can also update the
threshold from the same screen.
In the bottom, we get the details

around the bytes transferred
as well as the round-trip time.
Now coming to the optimized tab,
this tab has several new features

to help users explore
potential improvements

and changes to their existing
traffic configurations.
We can adjust the timelines

and we can see the
suggestions getting updated.

And we can get the suggestions
across all the regions.

Here the average time to
first byte is 30 milliseconds,
and I can compare with the other regions
in United States by selecting them.
And I click on apply.
And as you can see here, my average time

to first byte is different
for each regions.
And in the bottom we get the details
about each region suggestions.
And on the optimize tab,

we'll continue to show users
top location suggestions table

that details how each of their
top locations would perform
in this most optimal region.
Showing the most optimized configuration
for each location individually.
Now onto the configure tab

here it gives the details
of the internet monitor

and when it was created,
when it was modified,
and what are the city network limits,

and what is the current
status of the monitor.

And it also details the resources
that are being monitored
and also the healthy event thresholds.

We can update the thresholds
on this particular screen,

and here we get the internet
traffic graphs and the details

around the total traffic
monitoring coverage.
As you can see here,

a 100% of the total
traffic is being monitored
by 6 city-networks.

We can also see the details
around the 99% configuration
for the city-networks,
and we can see that 95%

of the traffic is coming
from 5 city-networks.

And we can also update
the monitoring coverage
on this particular screen.

And if you are to publish the
internet measurements to S3,
those details are visible here.
And also like if there are any tags

for our internet monitor,
they are available here.
With the new objects
to the Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor,
you can easily make informed decisions
on how to optimize your application setup
to enhance performance for your end users.
To no more, please refer the documentation

for Amazon CloudWatch
Internet Monitor here.

It has the details about
the supported regions,

the pricing, the components,
and how to configure.
Thanks for watching.
